title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic American novel set in the 1920s, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the elusive American Dream.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that delves into government surveillance, totalitarianism, and the dangers of absolute power.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A moving story about racial injustice and moral growth in the American South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story of teenage rebellion and alienation narrated by the iconic Holden Caulfield.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty and romantic tale highlighting societal expectations and personal misunderstandings in 19th-century England.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy adventure following Bilbo Baggins as he journeys across Middle-earth with dwarves and a wizard.
